trans-unit.source: Configure web apps in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Configure web apps in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to configure a web app in Azure App Services
trans-unit.target: How to configure a web app in Azure App Services

trans-unit.source: Configure web apps in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Configure web apps in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to configure a web app using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to configure a web app using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).

trans-unit.source: Application settings
trans-unit.target: Application settings

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com), open the blade for the web app.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com), open the blade for the web app.

trans-unit.source: Click **All Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **All Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Application Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Application Settings**.

trans-unit.source: The **Application settings** blade has settings grouped under several categories.
trans-unit.target: The **Application settings** blade has settings grouped under several categories.

trans-unit.source: General settings
trans-unit.target: General settings

trans-unit.source: **Framework versions**.
trans-unit.target: **Framework versions**.

trans-unit.source: Set these options if your app uses any these frameworks:
trans-unit.target: Set these options if your app uses any these frameworks:

trans-unit.source: **.NET Framework**: Set the .NET framework version.
trans-unit.target: **.NET Framework**: Set the .NET framework version.

trans-unit.source: **PHP**: Set the PHP version, or **OFF **to disable PHP.
trans-unit.target: **PHP**: Set the PHP version, or **OFF **to disable PHP.

trans-unit.source: **Java**: Select the Java version or **OFF** to disable Java.
trans-unit.target: **Java**: Select the Java version or **OFF** to disable Java.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Web Container** option to choose between Tomcat and Jetty versions.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Web Container** option to choose between Tomcat and Jetty versions.

trans-unit.source: **Python**: Select the Python version, or **OFF** to disable Python.
trans-unit.target: **Python**: Select the Python version, or **OFF** to disable Python.

trans-unit.source: For technical reasons, enabling Java for your app disables the .NET, PHP, and Python options.
trans-unit.target: For technical reasons, enabling Java for your app disables the .NET, PHP, and Python options.

trans-unit.source: **Platform**.
trans-unit.target: **Platform**.

trans-unit.source: Selects whether your web app runs in a 32-bit or 64-bit environment.
trans-unit.target: Selects whether your web app runs in a 32-bit or 64-bit environment.

trans-unit.source: The 64-bit environment requires Basic or Standard mode.
trans-unit.target: The 64-bit environment requires Basic or Standard mode.

trans-unit.source: Free and Shared modes always run in a 32-bit environment.
trans-unit.target: Free and Shared modes always run in a 32-bit environment.

trans-unit.source: **Web Sockets**.
trans-unit.target: **Web Sockets**.

trans-unit.source: Set **ON** to enable the WebSocket protocol; for example, if your web app uses [ASP.NET SignalR](http://www.asp.net/signalr) or [socket.io](web-sites-nodejs-chat-app-socketio.md).
trans-unit.target: Set **ON** to enable the WebSocket protocol; for example, if your web app uses [ASP.NET SignalR](http://www.asp.net/signalr) or [socket.io](web-sites-nodejs-chat-app-socketio.md).

trans-unit.source: **Always On**.
trans-unit.target: **Always On**.

trans-unit.source: By default, web apps are unloaded if they are idle for some period of time.
trans-unit.target: By default, web apps are unloaded if they are idle for some period of time.

trans-unit.source: This lets the system conserve resources.
trans-unit.target: This lets the system conserve resources.

trans-unit.source: In Basic or Standard mode, you can enable **Always On** to keep the app loaded all the time.
trans-unit.target: In Basic or Standard mode, you can enable **Always On** to keep the app loaded all the time.

trans-unit.source: If your app runs continuous web jobs, you should enable **Always On**, or the web jobs may not run reliably.
trans-unit.target: If your app runs continuous web jobs, you should enable **Always On**, or the web jobs may not run reliably.

trans-unit.source: **Managed Pipeline Version**.
trans-unit.target: **Managed Pipeline Version**.

trans-unit.source: Sets the IIS [pipeline mode](http://www.iis.net/learn/get-started/introduction-to-iis/introduction-to-iis-architecture#Application).
trans-unit.target: Sets the IIS [pipeline mode](http://www.iis.net/learn/get-started/introduction-to-iis/introduction-to-iis-architecture#Application).

trans-unit.source: Leave this set to Integrated (the default) unless you have a legacy app that requires an older version of IIS.
trans-unit.target: Leave this set to Integrated (the default) unless you have a legacy app that requires an older version of IIS.

trans-unit.source: **Auto Swap**.
trans-unit.target: **Auto Swap**.

trans-unit.source: If you enable Auto Swap for a deployment slot, App Service will automatically swap the web app into production when you push an update to that slot.
trans-unit.target: If you enable Auto Swap for a deployment slot, App Service will automatically swap the web app into production when you push an update to that slot.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Deploy to staging slots for web apps in Azure App Service] (web-sites-staged-publishing.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Deploy to staging slots for web apps in Azure App Service] (web-sites-staged-publishing.md).

trans-unit.source: Debugging
trans-unit.target: Debugging

trans-unit.source: **Remote Debugging**.
trans-unit.target: **Remote Debugging**.

trans-unit.source: Enables remote debugging.
trans-unit.target: Enables remote debugging.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, you can use the remote debugger in Visual Studio to connect directly to your web app.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, you can use the remote debugger in Visual Studio to connect directly to your web app.

trans-unit.source: Remote debugging will remain enabled for 48 hours.
trans-unit.target: Remote debugging will remain enabled for 48 hours.

trans-unit.source: App settings
trans-unit.target: App settings

trans-unit.source: This section contains name/value pairs that you web app will load on start up.
trans-unit.target: This section contains name/value pairs that you web app will load on start up.

trans-unit.source: For .NET apps, these settings are injected into your .NET configuration `AppSettings` at runtime, overriding existing settings.
trans-unit.target: For .NET apps, these settings are injected into your .NET configuration `AppSettings` at runtime, overriding existing settings.

trans-unit.source: PHP, Python, Java and Node applications can access these settings as environment variables at runtime.
trans-unit.target: PHP, Python, Java and Node applications can access these settings as environment variables at runtime.

trans-unit.source: For each app setting, two environment variables are created; one with the name specified by the app setting entry, and another with a prefix of APPSETTING_.
trans-unit.target: For each app setting, two environment variables are created; one with the name specified by the app setting entry, and another with a prefix of APPSETTING_.

trans-unit.source: Both contain the same value.
trans-unit.target: Both contain the same value.

trans-unit.source: Connection strings
trans-unit.target: Connection strings

trans-unit.source: Connection strings for linked resources.
trans-unit.target: Connection strings for linked resources.

trans-unit.source: For .NET apps, these connection strings are be injected into your .NET configuration `connectionStrings` settings at runtime, overriding existing entries where the key equals the linked database name.
trans-unit.target: For .NET apps, these connection strings are be injected into your .NET configuration `connectionStrings` settings at runtime, overriding existing entries where the key equals the linked database name.

trans-unit.source: For PHP, Python, Java and Node applications, these settings will be available as environment variables at runtime, prefixed with the connection type.
trans-unit.target: For PHP, Python, Java and Node applications, these settings will be available as environment variables at runtime, prefixed with the connection type.

trans-unit.source: The environment variable prefixes are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The environment variable prefixes are as follows:

trans-unit.source: SQL Server: SQLCONNSTR_
trans-unit.target: SQL Server: SQLCONNSTR_

trans-unit.source: MySQL: MYSQLCONNSTR_
trans-unit.target: MySQL: MYSQLCONNSTR_

trans-unit.source: SQL Database: SQLAZURECONNSTR_
trans-unit.target: SQL Database: SQLAZURECONNSTR_

trans-unit.source: Custom: CUSTOMCONNSTR_
trans-unit.target: Custom: CUSTOMCONNSTR_

trans-unit.source: For example, if a MySql connection string were named `connectionstring1`, it would be accessed through the environment variable `MYSQLCONNSTR_connectionString1`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a MySql connection string were named `connectionstring1`, it would be accessed through the environment variable `MYSQLCONNSTR_connectionString1`.

trans-unit.source: Default documents
trans-unit.target: Default documents

trans-unit.source: The default document is the web page that is displayed at the root URL for a website.
trans-unit.target: The default document is the web page that is displayed at the root URL for a website.

trans-unit.source: The first matching file in the list is used.
trans-unit.target: The first matching file in the list is used.

trans-unit.source: Web apps might use modules that route based on URL, rather than serving static content, in which case there is no default document as such.
trans-unit.target: Web apps might use modules that route based on URL, rather than serving static content, in which case there is no default document as such.

trans-unit.source: Handler mappings
trans-unit.target: Handler mappings

trans-unit.source: Use this area to add custom script processors to handle requests for specific file extensions.
trans-unit.target: Use this area to add custom script processors to handle requests for specific file extensions.

trans-unit.source: **Extension**.
trans-unit.target: **Extension**.

trans-unit.source: The file extension to be handled, such as *.php or handler.fcgi.
trans-unit.target: The file extension to be handled, such as *.php or handler.fcgi.

trans-unit.source: **Script Processor Path**.
trans-unit.target: **Script Processor Path**.

trans-unit.source: The absolute path of the script processor.
trans-unit.target: The absolute path of the script processor.

trans-unit.source: Requests to files that match the file extension will be processed by the script processor.
trans-unit.target: Requests to files that match the file extension will be processed by the script processor.

trans-unit.source: Use the path `D:\home\site\wwwroot` to refer to your app's root directory.
trans-unit.target: Use the path `D:\home\site\wwwroot` to refer to your app's root directory.

trans-unit.source: **Additional Arguments**.
trans-unit.target: **Additional Arguments**.

trans-unit.source: Optional command-line arguments for the script processor
trans-unit.target: Optional command-line arguments for the script processor

trans-unit.source: Virtual applications and directories
trans-unit.target: Virtual applications and directories

trans-unit.source: To configure virtual applications and directories, specify each virtual directory and its corresponding physical path relative to the website root.
trans-unit.target: To configure virtual applications and directories, specify each virtual directory and its corresponding physical path relative to the website root.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can select the **Application** checkbox to mark a virtual directory as an application.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can select the **Application** checkbox to mark a virtual directory as an application.

trans-unit.source: Enabling diagnostic logs
trans-unit.target: Enabling diagnostic logs

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostic logs:
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostic logs:

trans-unit.source: In the blade for your web app, click **All settings**.
trans-unit.target: In the blade for your web app, click **All settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Diagnostic logs**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Diagnostic logs**.

trans-unit.source: Options for writing diagnostic logs from a web application that supports logging:
trans-unit.target: Options for writing diagnostic logs from a web application that supports logging:

trans-unit.source: **Application Logging**.
trans-unit.target: **Application Logging**.

trans-unit.source: Writes application logs to the file system.
trans-unit.target: Writes application logs to the file system.

trans-unit.source: Logging lasts for a period of 12 hours.
trans-unit.target: Logging lasts for a period of 12 hours.

trans-unit.source: **Level**.
trans-unit.target: **Level**.

trans-unit.source: When application logging is enabled, this option specifies the amount of information that will be recorded (Error, Warning, Information, or Verbose).
trans-unit.target: When application logging is enabled, this option specifies the amount of information that will be recorded (Error, Warning, Information, or Verbose).

trans-unit.source: **Web server logging**.
trans-unit.target: **Web server logging**.

trans-unit.source: Logs are saved in the W3C extended log file format.
trans-unit.target: Logs are saved in the W3C extended log file format.

trans-unit.source: **Detailed error messages**.
trans-unit.target: **Detailed error messages**.

trans-unit.source: Saves detailed error messages .htm files.
trans-unit.target: Saves detailed error messages .htm files.

trans-unit.source: The files are saved under /LogFiles/DetailedErrors.
trans-unit.target: The files are saved under /LogFiles/DetailedErrors.

trans-unit.source: **Failed request tracing**.
trans-unit.target: **Failed request tracing**.

trans-unit.source: Logs failed requests to XML files.
trans-unit.target: Logs failed requests to XML files.

trans-unit.source: The files are saved under /LogFiles/W3SVC*xxx*, where xxx is a unique identifier.
trans-unit.target: The files are saved under /LogFiles/W3SVC*xxx*, where xxx is a unique identifier.

trans-unit.source: This folder contains an XSL file and one or more XML files.
trans-unit.target: This folder contains an XSL file and one or more XML files.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to download the XSL file, because it provides functionality for formatting and filtering the contents of the XML files.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to download the XSL file, because it provides functionality for formatting and filtering the contents of the XML files.

trans-unit.source: To view the log files, you must create FTP credentials, as follows:
trans-unit.target: To view the log files, you must create FTP credentials, as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the blade for your web app, click **All settings**.
trans-unit.target: In the blade for your web app, click **All settings**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deployment credentials**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deployment credentials**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Enter a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: The full FTP user name is “app\username” where *app* is the name of your web app.
trans-unit.target: The full FTP user name is “app\username” where *app* is the name of your web app.

trans-unit.source: The username is listed in the web app blade, under **Essentials**.
trans-unit.target: The username is listed in the web app blade, under **Essentials**.

trans-unit.source: Other configuration tasks
trans-unit.target: Other configuration tasks

trans-unit.source: SSL
trans-unit.target: SSL

trans-unit.source: In Basic or Standard mode, you can upload SSL certificates for a custom domain.
trans-unit.target: In Basic or Standard mode, you can upload SSL certificates for a custom domain.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable HTTPS for a web app](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable HTTPS for a web app](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md).

trans-unit.source: To view your uploaded certificates, click **All Settings** > **Custom domains and SSL**.
trans-unit.target: To view your uploaded certificates, click **All Settings** > **Custom domains and SSL**.

trans-unit.source: Domain names
trans-unit.target: Domain names

trans-unit.source: Add custom domain names for your web app.
trans-unit.target: Add custom domain names for your web app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Configure a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Configure a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md).

trans-unit.source: To view your domain names, click **All Settings** > **Custom domains and SSL**.
trans-unit.target: To view your domain names, click **All Settings** > **Custom domains and SSL**.

trans-unit.source: Deployments
trans-unit.target: Deployments

trans-unit.source: Set up continuous deployment.
trans-unit.target: Set up continuous deployment.

trans-unit.source: See [Using Git to deploy Web Apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-publish-source-control.md)
trans-unit.target: See [Using Git to deploy Web Apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-publish-source-control.md)

trans-unit.source: Deployment slots.
trans-unit.target: Deployment slots.

trans-unit.source: See [Deploy to Staging Environments for Web Apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-staged-publishing.md)
trans-unit.target: See [Deploy to Staging Environments for Web Apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-staged-publishing.md)

trans-unit.source: To view your deployment slots, click **All Settings** > **Deployment slots**.
trans-unit.target: To view your deployment slots, click **All Settings** > **Deployment slots**.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Monitoring

trans-unit.source: In Basic or Standard mode, you can test the availability of HTTP or HTTPS endpoints, from up to three geo-distributed locations.
trans-unit.target: In Basic or Standard mode, you can test the availability of HTTP or HTTPS endpoints, from up to three geo-distributed locations.

trans-unit.source: A monitoring test fails if the HTTP response code is an error (4xx or 5xx) or the response takes more than 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: A monitoring test fails if the HTTP response code is an error (4xx or 5xx) or the response takes more than 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: An endpoint is considered available if the monitoring tests succeed from all the specified locations.
trans-unit.target: An endpoint is considered available if the monitoring tests succeed from all the specified locations.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to: Monitor web endpoint status](http://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=279906&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to: Monitor web endpoint status](http://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=279906&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
